intro.description: The goal of SLA management process is to ensure that an agreed level of IT services is provide for all current IT services and that the future services are delivered to agreed achievable targets. SLA management process should ensure that all operational services and their performance are measured in a consistent, professional manner throughout the IT organization, and that the services and the reports produced, meet the needs of the business and customers.

item.title: SLAMP.A1 – Determine SLA Framework
item.description: This activity should design the most appropriate SLA structure to ensure that all the services and all the customers are covered in a manner best suited to the organization’s needs

item.title: SLAMP.A2 - Determine, document and agree requirements for existing and new services
item.description: All those issues included in the SLA framework should be determined and documented and agreed for each provided service.

item.title: SLAMP.A3 - Review underpinning agreements
item.description: If the service providers are dependent to some extent in external partners or suppliers, they cannot commit to meeting SLA target unless supplier´s performances underpin these targets. Contracts with external supplier are mandatory, in these contracts should reflect the need to ensure that all the targets with in underpinning are aligned with and support targets agreed in the SLAs.

item.title: SLAMP.A4 - Monitor service performance against SLA
item.description: This activity will monitor the provided services against to the agreed parameters in the SLA in the activity SLAMP.A2. Mechanisms to control potential deviations should be put in place. This activity is repeated with the periodicity which is defined in the SLA

item.title: SLAMP.A5 – Produce service reports
item.description: The SLA reporting mechanisms must be defined and agreed with the customer. The periodic reports should incorporate details of performance against all SLA targets. It is important for elaborating these reports to collect accurate information from all the areas and other processes and measured against the agreed business targets. During this activity, reports on the performance of the services should be produce, this performance of the services should be checked against the SLA and in case of any non-conformance, an information report should be produced and propagated to the affected parts.

item.title: SLAMP.A6 Review SLAs and underpinning agreements
item.description: All the SLAs and underpinning agreements must be kept updated. These reviews should ensure that the services covered and the targets for each are still relevant, and that nothing significant has changed that invalidates the agreement in any way. This activity should be carried out at least each time that major changes or incidence have been found.
